result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Brown

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Pretrial Services 10-31-2022 Violation Report
Received and Filed. letter to court

Defendant Matthew Brown in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Matthew Brown.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared in court on behalf of Patrick T. Franken for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State. Defense counsel further requests a motion hearing date. Court advises counsel that she only calendars motion hearings, upon one being filed. Court thereby schedules the next court date for a status conference date, and sets 11/17/2022 deadline to file any motions. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services 10-10-2022 Supervision Report

Defendant Matthew Brown appeared by video.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Matthew Brown.  Prosecuting Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Romeo.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Court reminded the defendant to continue working with Justice Point. Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9.7.22

Defendant De Janea L Kirksey not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD has not appointed Counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report 7.29.22

Defendant Matthew Brown in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; on vacation. Defense moves to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Matthew Brown in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests a State v. Lee hearing. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Matthew Brown in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Matthew Brown in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matthew Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
